issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

comments.body: [~jojochuang] I'd suggest to return null instead of "" to keep consistent with socket.getRemoteAddress()

Thanks [~yuanbo] your suggestion makes sense to me.

Searching the Hadoop again, I can see getRemoteAddressString() get used in an exception catch block within {{DataXceiver#replaceBlock()}}. Now when I think about this again, the exception handler within {{DataXceiver#replaceBlock()}} and {{BlockReaderRemote.sendReadResult}}, and it would print like "Error writing reply back to null". While that's fine, could we make it more easier to understand, by checking that getRemoteAddressString() returns null and say "Error writing reply back, socket closed?" It would be even better if we could cache the remote address string before the exception, so the even if the socket is closed we could still find the remote address?
Good idea. I'll update my patch according to your comments.
